ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-13T21:20:54 [Issue ID 4000-129545] urn:comicvine:4000-129545 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-16 23:54:22. [Issue ID 93836]
ComicInfo.Summary:
New Morris Philip Gives You a Natural Smoke with an Un-natural Light!: Parody of ad for Phillip Morris cigarettes.
Personalized TV Antennas: Customized tv antennas to show your profession or hobby.
TV Movies With Built-In Commercials: What tv dramas might look like if they embedded commercials directly within movies.
MAD Hats: Everyday household containers used as women's hats.
My Fren' Dufo: Story of Wally Cox's incredibly stupid boyhood friend.
Scenes We'd Like to See: The Duel: At a gun duel, the seconds and other spectators shoot each other and the man in charge of the weapons finishes off the crowd.
Blind Date: A story of a blind date, as told differently by the boy and girl involved.
Parking Meters: Parking meters for all types of waiting activities, and a solution to the problem.
The Nursery News: Nursery rhymes reported as realistic news stories. Fake photos credited to Ozgood Z'Beard and Melvin Coznowfski.
Paul Sturdley's Secret File: Interview with a notorious kitten dumper.
Cowboys 'n Indians: Story of how the handbook of real Indian lore that came with a kid's Indian outfit saved the day.
Raw Guts: Parody of men's magazines, with beginnings of several adventure stories.
Home Movies: Comparing the improved photographic opportunities presented by movies versus still cameras.
Bomb Song Hits: Parodies to songs are written for the post-nuclear war days.
OK! Gunfight at the Corral!: Parody of movie "Gunfight At The OK Corral."
The Children's Hour: Humorous drawings to illustrate the famous poem, with a macabre ending.
Mr. Morgan Tells the Story of the 12 Bottles: Henry empties his 12 bottles of whiskey down the sink, except for one glass per bottle...which he drinks.
A Martian Field Guide to U.S. Wild Life - 1957 Edition: Details of pop culture stereotypes presented as a field guide to wildlife from a Martian point of view.
Scenes We'd Like to See: The Human Shield: A bank robber takes a hostage to enable his getaway, but she turns out to be in on the scheme.

Gunfight at the Corral!; The Children's Hour; Mr. Morgan Tells the Story of the 12 Bottles; A Martian Field Guide to U.S. Wild Life - 1957 Edition; Scenes We'd Like to See: The Human Shield
ComicInfo.Writer: Frank Jacobs,Dave Berg,Bob Elliott,Ray Goulding,Don Martin,Paul Laikin,Al Feldstein,Jerry De Fuccio,Nick Meglin,Albert B. Feldstein,Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,Henry Morgan
ComicInfo.Penciller: Kelly Freas,Bob Clarke,Wally Wood,Basil Wolverton,George Woodbridge,Joe Orlando,Dave Berg,Mort Drucker,Don Martin,Albert B. Feldstein
